00051 #ifndef OPTIONS_H
00052 #define OPTIONS_H
00053 
00054 #ifdef __cplusplus
00055 extern "C" {
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 /* set to surpress notes */
00059 extern bool opt_ignore_notes;
00060 
00061 /*
00062  * This options package allows the user to specify the name, description,
00063  * location, and default values of program option variables.  In addition,
00064  * two builtin options are supported:
00065  *
00066  *   -config <filename>         # load options from <filename>
00067  *   -dumpconfig <filename>     # save current option into <filename>
00068  *
00069  * NOTE: all user-installed option names must begin with a `-', e.g., `-debug'
00070  */
00071 
00072 /* option variable classes */
00073 enum opt_class_t {
00074   oc_int = 0,           /* integer option */
00075   oc_uint,              /* unsigned integer option */
00076   oc_float,             /* float option */
00077   oc_double,            /* double option */
00078   oc_enum,              /* enumeration option */
00079   oc_flag,              /* boolean option */
00080   oc_string,            /* string option */
00081   oc_long_long,         /* long long option */
00082   oc_NUM
00083 };
00084 
00085 /* user-specified option definition */
00086 struct opt_opt_t {
00087   struct opt_opt_t *next;       /* next option */
00088   const char *name;                     /* option name, e.g., "-foo:bar" */
00089   const char *desc;                     /* option description */
00090   int nvars;                    /* > 1 if var for list options */
00091   int *nelt;                    /* number of elements parsed */
00092   const char *format;                   /* option value print format */
00093   int print;                    /* print option during `-dumpconfig'? */
00094   int accrue;                   /* accrue list across uses */
00095   enum opt_class_t oc;          /* class of this option */
00096   union opt_variant_t {
00097     /* oc == oc_int */
00098     struct opt_for_int_t {
00099       int *var;                 /* pointer to integer option */
00100     } for_int;
00101     /* oc == oc_uint */
00102     struct opt_for_uint_t {
00103       unsigned int *var;        /* pointer to unsigned integer option */
00104     } for_uint;
00105     /* oc == oc_float */
00106     struct opt_for_float_t {
00107       float *var;               /* pointer to float option */
00108     } for_float;
00109     /* oc == oc_double */
00110     struct opt_for_double_t {
00111       double *var;              /* pointer to double option */
00112     } for_double;
00113     /* oc == oc_enum, oc_flag */
00114     struct opt_for_enum_t {
00115       char *var;                        /* ptr to *char* enum option, NOTE: A CHAR (for compatibility with C++ bool's) */
00116       char **emap;              /* array of enum strings */
00117       char *eval;               /* optional array of enum values */
00118       int emap_sz;              /* number of enum's in arrays */
00119     } for_enum;
00120     /* oc == oc_string */
00121     struct opt_for_string_t {
00122       char **var;               /* pointer to string pointer option */
00123     } for_string;
00124     struct opt_for_long_long_t {
00125       long long *var;           /* pointer to string pointer option */
00126     } for_long_long;
00127   } variant;
00128 };
00129 
00130 /* user-specified argument orphan parser, called when an argument is
00131    encountered that is not claimed by a user-installed option */
00132 typedef int
00133 (*orphan_fn_t)(int i,           /* index of the orphan'ed argument */
00134                int argc,        /* number of program arguments */
00135                char **argv);    /* program arguments */
00136 
00137 /* an option note, these trail the option list when help or option state
00138    is printed */
00139 struct opt_note_t {
00140   struct opt_note_t *next;      /* next option note */
00141   char *note;                   /* option note */
00142 };
00143 
00144 /* option database definition */
00145 struct opt_odb_t {
00146   struct opt_opt_t *options;    /* user-installed options in option database */
00147   orphan_fn_t orphan_fn;        /* user-specified orphan parser */
00148   char *header;                 /* options header */
00149   struct opt_note_t *notes;     /* option notes */
00150 };
00151 
00152 /* create a new option database */
00153 struct opt_odb_t *
00154 opt_new(orphan_fn_t orphan_fn);         /* user-specified orphan parser */
00155 
00156 /* free an option database */
00157 void
00158 opt_delete(struct opt_odb_t *odb);      /* option database */
00159 
00160 /* register an long long option variable */
00161 void
00162 opt_reg_long_long(struct opt_odb_t *odb,        /* option database */
00163             char *name,                 /* option name */
00164             char *desc,                 /* option description */
00165             long long *var,                     /* pointer to option variable */
00166             long long def_val,          /* default value of option variable */
00167             int print,                  /* print during `-dumpconfig' */
00168             char *format);              /* optional user print format */
00169 
00170 /* register an integer option variable */
00171 void
00172 opt_reg_int(struct opt_odb_t *odb,      /* option database */
00173             char *name,                 /* option name */
00174             char *desc,                 /* option description */
00175             int *var,                   /* pointer to option variable */
00176             int def_val,                /* default value of option variable */
00177             int print,                  /* print during `-dumpconfig' */
00178             char *format);              /* optional user print format */
00179 
00180 /* register an integer option list */
00181 void
00182 opt_reg_int_list(struct opt_odb_t *odb, /* option database */
00183                  char *name,            /* option name */
00184                  char *desc,            /* option description */
00185                  int *vars,             /* pointer to option array */
00186                  int nvars,             /* total entries in option array */
00187                  int *nelt,             /* number of entries parsed */
00188                  int *def_val,          /* default value of option array */
00189                  int print,             /* print during `-dumpconfig'? */
00190                  char *format,          /* optional user print format */
00191                  int accrue);           /* accrue list across uses */
00192

00194 void
00195 opt_reg_uint(struct opt_odb_t *odb,     /* option database */
00196              char *name,                /* option name */

00198              unsigned int *var,         /* pointer to option variable */
00199              unsigned int def_val,      /* default value of option variable */
00200              int print,                 /* print during `-dumpconfig'? */
00201              char *format);             /* optional user print format */
00202

00204 void
00205 opt_reg_uint_list(struct opt_odb_t *odb,/* option database */
00206                   char *name,           /* option name */
00207                   char *desc,           /* option description */
00208                   unsigned int *vars,   /* pointer to option array */
00209                   int nvars,            /* total entries in option array */
00210                   int *nelt,            /* number of elements parsed */
00211                   unsigned int *def_val,/* default value of option array */
00212                   int print,            /* print during `-dumpconfig'? */
00213                   char *format,         /* optional user print format */
00214                   int accrue);          /* accrue list across uses */

00217 void
00218 opt_reg_float(struct opt_odb_t *odb,    /* option data base */
00219               char *name,               /* option name */
00220               char *desc,               /* option description */
00221               float *var,               /* target option variable */
00222               float def_val,            /* default variable value */
00223               int print,                /* print during `-dumpconfig'? */
00224               char *format);            /* optional value print format */

00227 void
00228 opt_reg_float_list(struct opt_odb_t *odb,/* option data base */
00229                    char *name,          /* option name */
00230                    char *desc,          /* option description */
00231                    float *vars,         /* target array */
00232                    int nvars,           /* target array size */
00233                    int *nelt,           /* number of args parsed goes here */
00234                    float *def_val,      /* default variable value */

00260                     int accrue);        /* accrue list across uses */

00262 /* register an enumeration option variable, NOTE: all enumeration option
00263    variables must be of type `int', since true enum variables may be allocated
00264    with variable sizes by some compilers */
00265 void
00266 opt_reg_enum(struct opt_odb_t *odb,     /* option data base */
00267              char *name,                /* option name */
00268              char *desc,                /* option description */
00269              int *var,                  /* target variable */
00270              char *def_val,             /* default variable value */
00271              char **emap,               /* enumeration string map */
00272              int *eval,                 /* enumeration value map, optional */
00273              int emap_sz,               /* size of maps */
00274              int print,                 /* print during `-dumpconfig'? */
00275              char *format);             /* optional value print format */
00276 
00277 /* register an enumeration option array, NOTE: all enumeration option variables
00278    must be of type `int', since true enum variables may be allocated with
00279    variable sizes by some compilers */
00280 void

00350                  FILE *fd);             /* output stream */
00351

00353 void
00354 opt_print_options(struct opt_odb_t *odb,/* option data base */
00355                   FILE *fd,             /* output stream */

00357                   int notes);           /* include notes? */

00366 opt_find_option(struct opt_odb_t *odb,  /* option database */

00371 opt_reg_header(struct opt_odb_t *odb,   /* option database */
